description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7d05h","text":"Indirect Proximity Ligation Assay (PLA) is a powerful molecular technique used to detect and visualize protein-protein interactions, protein modifications, and protein complex formations within cells or tissues. This method is based on the principles of proximity-dependent ligation and utilizes specific antibodies to detect the nitration of proteins on free-floating brain sections. Here we describe the PLA protocol that we routinely use in our laboratory to detect nitrated alpha-synuclein and nitration of mitochondrial enzymes such as SOD2 and the mitochondrial complex 1 subunit NDUFB8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85dpn","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27p7h","text":"

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mrdm","text":"\nPick 35um cut brain sections and transfer them to   Eppendorf tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64f62","text":"Note: all incubation and wash steps are performed by shaking Eppendorf tubes at 250rpm (e.g., thermomixer)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cko2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"BF2254F0313511EEAF761522229A0D4E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
